meanings.definition: A group or system of interconnected people or things.
meanings.sent1: In our neighborhood, we have a network of friends who always help each other.
meanings.sent2: The computer network at my school allows us to share information easily.
meanings.sent3: The network of squirrels in the park always seem to know where the best acorns are.
meanings.sent4: The network of roads in the city can be compared to a spider's web, connecting every corner.
meanings.sent5: The network of blood vessels in our body is essential for transporting nutrients and oxygen.

meanings.definition: A system of broadcasting or telecommunications.
meanings.sent1: The television network airs all the latest shows for us to enjoy.
meanings.sent2: I rely on the phone network to stay connected with my family and friends.
meanings.sent3: The network of satellites in space helps us communicate with people all over the world.
meanings.sent4: The radio network broadcasts news and music to listeners everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The internet network allows us to access a vast amount of information with just a few clicks.
